message: My office, along with the offices of Senator Heidi Heitkamp and Congressman Kevin Cramer, will be hosting an informational Service Academy Evening at the Raymond J. Bohn Armory in Bismarck on May 24th. The event will take place from 6:00 p.m. to 7:30 p.m., and will feature representatives from the Air Force Academy, the Naval Academy and Military Academy-West Point.   Eligible Service Academy applicants must be unmarried United States citizens with no dependents, a North Dakota resident and at least 17 years old but not past their 23rd birthday on July 1st the year of admittance. The application deadline is October 13, 2017. I encourage applicants to apply to all North Dakota Congressional offices. For more information, visit https://www.hoeven.senate.gov/serving-you/academy-nominations
Mikey and I wish you and your loved ones health and happiness in 2017. Happy New Year!
Senator John Hoeven Second Term Swearing In.
Video from my second term swearing in ceremony. For more, visit: https://goo.gl/yEylZ0

I met with Rick Perry, nominee for Secretary of the U.S. Department of Energy. I highlighted North Dakota’s energy leadership and the importance of empowering energy development and reducing regulatory burden on America’s job creators. I also invited Perry to #NorthDakota to see firsthand our efforts to develop both traditional and renewable energy, and the work being done at the University of North Dakota Energy & Environmental Research Center (EERC).

#Israel is our closest natural ally in Middle East, and we must commit ourselves to its security. That is why I cosponsored a bipartisan resolution opposing the United Nations Security Council’s Resolution 2334. The #inauguration is an occasion when we can all come together and honor our Constitution’s provision for the peaceful transfer of power. We look forward to working with the new administration to advance priorities for both #NorthDakota and the nation. These include working to create jobs and reducing the regulatory burden to help grow our economy. We also have to support our military, which means ensuring they have the tools they need to defend our nation. We also need to get on top of our debt and deficit, build our energy economy and support our farmers and ranchers so they can continue to provide our country with the highest quality, lowest cost food in the world.
#NorthDakota ranks no. 1 on WalletHub’s 2017 Best & Worst States to Raise a Family: https://goo.gl/9l2pEH

The President has nominated Judge Neil Gorsuch to serve as an Associate Justice on the Supreme Court of the United States. As a judge on the 10th Circuit for the past decade, he has the experience necessary to serve on our nation’s highest court.

That includes building on the success of the Fargo VA Health Care System’s Care Coordination initiative and my legislation to provide veterans with long term care and health care closer to home. For more, goo.gl/2PLmUz

The President signed into law our legislation to stop the one-size-fits-all Stream Buffer Rule, which threatened to eliminate thousands of jobs, decrease state tax revenues and increase electricity prices for consumers. This afternoon I met with Patterson Lake homeowners to outline our legislation enabling them to purchase their lots. Our legislation would also transfer ownership of all federal lands around Patterson Lake to private and local public ownership. For more, goo.gl/y2Lns3

Happy to join folks from Evolve Grand Forks as they open The 701, a coworking space to help entrepreneurs and startups start and build their businesses – great asset for the #GrandForks community. goo.gl/bB6bIF

Glad to review the U.S. Department of Agriculture research lab in Mandan and learn more about important Ag research. We also spoke with local farmers to gather input on research priorities as we work on an Ag appropriations bill and start work on the 2018 Farm Bill: goo.gl/U7WYLG

Our #farmers & #ranchers produce the highest quality, lowest cost food in the world. Happy #NationalAgDay.
I was glad to see students from #Belfield High School who stopped by my D.C. office for a tour of the Capitol.

Talked with Bobcat Company North America President Rich Goldsbury about ways to improve our nation’s infrastructure.

I invited U.S. Department of Agriculture nominee Sonny Perdue to visit #NorthDakota to meet with farmers and ranchers and to see firsthand the innovative agricultural research being conducted at places like North Dakota State University's North Dakota Agricultural Experiment Station. This is important as we work to craft a new farm bill, maintain strong crop insurance, update programs to help producers in times of crisis, support the no-cost sugar program and provide flexibility in school nutrition programs to ensure schools can meet their budgets and serve students nutritious food. The Trump Administration has approved the permit to build the Keystone XL Pipeline. This project is not only about energy, but also job creation, economic growth and making America more secure by reducing our dependence on Middle Eastern oil. For more, goo.gl/3Vvwgn
Congratulations to North Dakota National Guard's 461st Engineer Company on receiving the 2016 Department of Defense Reserve Family Readiness Award in recognition of the unit’s family support program.

FEMA has agreed to a 30-day extension for Drayton to keep in place its earthen levee. I’m working to pass legislation to keep the levee as part of permanent flood control protections. For more, bit.ly/2ntJBHf

We need to focus on the fundamentals to help grow #NorthDakota’s economy. We can get there by building a pro-growth business environment that spurs new private-sector investment, which means reducing the regulatory burden and passing tax reform. I outlined these in my essay in The Bismarck Tribune as part of the paper’s Vision ’17 special section: bit.ly/2nFA8go

Judge Neil Gorsuch is a strong Supreme Court pick for #NorthDakota and our nation. He has shown deep respect for the Constitution and is a mainstream judge, who will provide an important safeguard against federal overreach. The Senate unanimously confirmed Judge Gorsuch to the 10th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in 2006, and I am hopeful that the Senate will again approve him with strong, bipartisan support. For more, bit.ly/2njkt3n
I was glad to see students from around #NorthDakota this morning. They are in Washington, D.C. this week to see the sites and learn more about history and how our government works.

Today I joined Interior Secretary Zinke who signed orders reviewing, revising and rescinding the Bureau of Land Management’s (BLM) duplicative regulations for methane and hydraulic fracturing on federal lands, and rescinding the moratorium on federal coal leasing. For more, bit.ly/2nvumvz
I was glad to discuss tourism priorities for our state with Sara with Travel North Dakota and Charley with Visit Fargo-Moorhead.
Thank you to those brave men and women who served in Vietnam and sacrificed so much for our freedom. #VietnamVeteransDay

The Senate Agriculture Committee today advanced the nomination of Agriculture Secretary Nominee Sonny Perdue. Perdue will be a good advocate for farmers and ranchers across the nation and he understands the importance of building a strong North, South and Midwest coalition to pass the next farm bill. For more, bit.ly/2oeRKk8

Innovative folks like Sarah Lovas from the Hillsboro area make our rural communities strong. Sarah is a 4th generation #NorthDakota farmer, owns a crop consulting business and is a soil fertility expert with a master’s in soil science from North Dakota State University. I am glad her work has been highlighted for #WomensHistoryMonth: https://twitter.com/SenateAgGOP/status/846399839676088325

I was glad to co-sponsor important legislation passed by the Senate today to extend the Veterans Choice Program. This will help reduce wait times for appointments and strengthen care coordination. We have and will continue to work hard to ensure the Veterans Choice Program works well in #NorthDakota through our Veterans Care Coordination Initiative with the Fargo VA Health Care System, which we are pushing to use as a model in improving how we care for our #veterans nationwide. For more, bit.ly/2ouSh1C

The U.S. Forest Service has agreed to halt a planned grazing fee increase on National Great Plains Grasslands, which is good news for our #ranchers. This rate increase reflected an unrealistic understanding of cattle markets in #NorthDakota and other states, which is why I worked to roll back this increase: bit.ly/2oyIAPV

I met with U.S. Department of Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao and outlined to her my Move America legislation which will expand tax-exempt funding for public-private partnerships to help fund important infrastructure projects. For more, bit.ly/2oD4QI2

I spoke on the Senate floor today about Judge Neil Gorsuch, who has been nominated to be a justice on the U.S. Supreme Court. In 2006, the Senate unanimously confirmed Judge Gorsuch to the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals where, over the last decade, he has demonstrated his deep respect for the Constitution and his commitment to upholding the rule of law. He is good for North Dakota and the nation.

Department of Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly accepted my invitation to visit #NorthDakota today at a Senate Homeland Security Committee hearing. UAS technology will help us secure our borders and support DHS’ mission, and I’m glad Secretary Kelly has agreed to see our work to develop #UAS as well as work at the border station in Pembina which is responsible for protecting more than 900 miles of border. For more, bit.ly/2oJ1O25

I was glad to join a bipartisan group of senators in urging the President to remove barriers for U.S. beef exports to China. China, the second largets importer of beef in the world, lifted its ban on U.S. beef in September, but technical barriers still remain that prevent our producers from accessing the market. For more: bit.ly/2odtfmH

Congratulations to our newest Supreme Court justice, Neil Gorsuch. I was glad to join a bipartisan majority of senators in confirming Justice Gorsuch, who will be good for North Dakota and our nation. He has demonstrated fair and prudent judgement in his opinions and shown that he will uphold the rule of law rather than trying to legislate from the bench. For more, bit.ly/2nTqvIb
Good read in the Grand Forks Herald on a study that says #NorthDakota is the best state in the nation for women entrepreneurs: trib.al/HDTJlZ3
Happy Easter to you and your loved ones. May you be blessed as we celebrate this day.

I joined Fargo-Moorhead area leaders today in Horace to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the 1997 flood in the Red River Valley. The ceremony included a groundbreaking for the construction of the inlet structure for Fargo-Moorhead’s permanent flood protection. We need comprehensive flood protection for the whole region to safeguard against the damage and loss like we saw in 1997. For more, bit.ly/2pba2DD
I was glad to answer questions this morning and talk with business students from the University of Mary.

At the Bismarck-Mandan Chamber of Commerce today, I outlined how we’re working to provide regulatory relief and build a better business climate for our nation’s job creators. Thank you to the Chamber and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce who presented me with the Spirit of Enterprise Award; I look forward to continuing to work with them to support businesses, create jobs and strengthen our economy. For more, bit.ly/2oJSE5W

I was glad to join the #GrandForks community last night at a retirement celebration for Bruce Gjovig, founder and director of the University of North Dakota's Center for Innovation. I have greatly enjoyed working with Bruce throughout the years. Our state, UND and so many individuals are indebted to Bruce and his work, and we wish him the best. For more, bit.ly/2pz658I

I outlined our efforts to support North Dakota’s coal industry at the Lignite Energy Council annual meeting in Bismarck. Our lignite industry does a great job providing efficient, affordable and reliable electricity for the whole region and we’re working with the new Administration to provide the industry with greater certainty and support. For more, bit.ly/2ot5x2v

Yesterday I had the opportunity to commemorate the hard work and innovation of the folks at Killdeer Mountain Manufacturing (KMM) as we celebrated KMM’s 30th anniversary and the expansion of its Dickinson facility. #NorthDakota continues to grow in our work with aviation research and development, whether through work of companies like KMM or with our #UAS work. This work has been helped by the pro-growth business environment in our state, and we will continue to work to create jobs and a strong economy. For more, bit.ly/2oPsgJf

Earlier today I was glad to join state, local and #UAS industry leaders, and Northrop Grumman Corporation VP Janis Pamiljans, in celebrating the grand opening of Northrop Grumman's new 36,000 sq. ft. facility at the Grand Sky Technology Park in #GrandForks. The new building will be used to conduct UAS research and development, training, mission analysis and aircraft maintenance, and is expected to have 100 employees by the end of this year. This is an exciting addition to our #NorthDakota UAS ecosystem and will help us continue to realize the full benefits of UAS technology and integrate UAS into our national airspace. For more, bit.ly/2pMVTfH

Today I held an Indian Affairs Committee oversight hearing at Cankdeska Cikana Community College in Fort Totten on protecting Indian children and the implementation of my Native American Children’s Safety Act.

Today I was glad to join a large bipartisan majority of senators in confirming former Georgia Governor George “Sonny” Perdue to be the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Agriculture. Secretary Perdue has committed to advancing the priorities of our producers, including building a strong coalition to pass the next #farmbill and providing support for rural communities during these tough times in the farm patch. Secretary Perdue will be a strong leader for USDA and a great advocate for #agriculture. For more, bit.ly/2oZ6Hq0

I met with Heather Wilson, the nominee for secretary of the United States Air Force, to underscore the importance of #NorthDakota’s Air Force missions in defending our nation. We need to continue to modernize the nuclear mission at Minot Air Force Base, Global Hawk and #UAS operations at Warriors of the North-Grand Forks Air Force Base and support the Air National Guard in Fargo. For more, bit.ly/2oM0ESW
I was glad to talk yesterday afternoon with individuals from electric cooperatives from around #NorthDakota about their important work powering communities in our state.
Yesterday I joined Senator Heidi Heitkamp, Senator Amy Klobuchar, U.S. Senator Al Franken and Senator Tammy Baldwin in calling on Agriculture Secretary Perdue to help our dry bean #farmers.
Good seeing students this morning from Beach, Hettinger and White Shield high schools.
Good to see 2017 North Dakota Teacher of the Year Nanci Dauwen and her husband Wayne. Nanci teaches math at #WestFargo’s Sheyenne High School.

We need to replace the Air Force’s old and outdated Huey helicopter fleet. That is why I joined a bipartisan group of senators and representatives in asking Secretary of Defense James Mattis to not delay in modernizing the helicopters that protect our ICBMs like those around Minot Air Force Base. Read more: bit.ly/2oELpiI

Outlined to Disabled American Veterans, Department of North Dakota convention in Mandan our work to provide #veterans with timely, quality health care options closer to home. This includes extending the Veterans Choice Program and building on the success of the Veterans Care Coordination initiative with the Fargo VA Health Care System.

You can find more specifics here: bit.ly/2qoNcID

Thanks to students from Glen Ullin High School for stopping by my DC office this morning. It was good to hear about what they’re learning as well as post-graduation plans.

Though he gave the ultimate sacrifice in so doing, Adam's efforts to slow down enemy Panther tanks helped save the lives of many and merited a posthumous Silver Star Medal. BREAKING NEWS: The U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia has said that the water supply project for a 10-county area in northwest #NorthDakota, called the Northwest Area Water Supply (NAWS) project, can move forward. I’ve worked since my time as governor to help advance the NAWS project, which will provide a clean and reliable water supply for more than 100,000 North Dakotans. Construction began in 2002 and we worked from 2001 to 2010 to meet legal challenges and secure state and federal funding for the project. During that time, the system became operational, delivering water to Berthold, Burlington, Glenburn, Kenmare, Max, Minot, Mohall and Sherwood. Now that the lawsuits are resolved, the project can be finished, bringing a new water supply to the communities of Bottineau, Renville, Souris and Westhope and allowing the intake and water treatment plant to be constructed at #LakeSakakawea. You can read more about the NAWS project here: bit.ly/2wPRkAX

Navy Fireman 1st Class Lawrence H. Fecho of Willow City was assigned to the USS Oklahoma during WWII. On December 7, 1941, the ship was moored at Ford Island, Pearl Harbor, when it was attacked by Japanese aircraft. More than 400 crewmen were killed in the attack, including Lawrence. He was 20 years old. This afternoon, Lawrence was finally laid to rest at home in North Dakota with full military honors, and flags in North Dakota are flying at half-staff today in his honor. The first pictures are of Lawrence’s remains arriving in Fargo on Friday.
